snippet: The Nationals’ expected deal with Max Scherzer, what would be the richest for a right-handed pitcher, would give them an overpowering rotation.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that Washington Nationals are counting on starting pitching as critical factor for success; says seven-year deal with Max Scherzer at $210 million sets record for right-handed pitcher and gives team an overwhelming rotation.
lead_paragraph: The Nationals’ expected deal with Max Scherzer, what would be the richest for a right-handed pitcher, would give them an overpowering rotation.

headline.print_headline: Looking Ahead to October, Nationals Bank on Pitching
headline.seo: Max Scherzer Set to Give Nationals an Overpowering Rotation
headline.main: Looking Ahead to October, Washington Banks on Pitching
